snippet: An inquiry found that a principal let students make up credits in classes where they received no substantial instruction and, in some cases, were not required to have contact with teachers.
abstract: New York City Dept of Education announces that it will fire John Dewey High School principal Kathleen Elvin after yearlong investigation reveals grade-fixing scam behind rise in graduation rates.
lead_paragraph: An inquiry found that a principal let students make up credits in classes where they received no substantial instruction and, in some cases, were not required to have contact with teachers.

headline.main: Principal to Be Fired Over Investigation Into Grade-Fixing at a Brooklyn School
headline.print_headline: Principal to Be Fired Over Investigation Into Grade-Fixing at a Brooklyn School
